item.title: Enforcing Java Record Invariants With Bean Validation
item.description: Table of Contents Record Invariants and Bean Validation Implementation Advantages Limitations Wrap-Up Record types are one of the most awaited features in Java 14; they promise to "provide a compact syntax for declaring classes which are transparent holders for shallowly immutable data". One example where records should be beneficial are data transfer objects (DTOs), as e.g. found in the remoting layer of enterprise applications.
